summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorney Laura Menninger regarding discovery issues in US v. Maxwell, specifically concerning the review and production of images and videos seized from Jeffrey Epstein's devices. The government details plans to de-designate thousands of images from 'Highly Confidential' to 'Confidential' and to make evidence available for review in Colorado.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Partner at Haddon, Morgan & Foreman, P.C. representing Ghislaine Maxwell; corresponds with AUSA regarding discovery deficiencies, review of images/videos from Epstein's devices, and logistical arrangements for evidence inspection.

events.title: Scheduled Trial Date for US v. Maxwell
events.description: Trial date mentioned in correspondence as November 29, 2021.

events.title: FBI Report on Epstein Evidence
events.description: FBI report dated January 27, 2021, indicating approximately 33,747 Highly Confidential images and 895 HC videos identified from CART-processed evidence from Epstein's devices.

locations: 500 Pearl (likely a government building in NY)
keyFacts: The FBI had approximately 33,747 images and 895 videos designated as 'Highly Confidential' from Epstein's devices, contradicting an earlier verbal estimate of 2,100.
The government agreed to transfer hard drives and boots (evidence items) to the FBI field office in Colorado for defense review, but certain photographs (1A items) must remain in New York.
Defense attorney Laura Menninger argued that many 'Highly Confidential' images contained adult nudity but not child pornography, and requested copies for proper defense analysis.
Significant discovery problems were cited, including corrupt files, missing metadata, unreadable photo formats, and thousands of documents the defendant could not view at the detention center.

The Protective Order defined 'Highly Confidential' material as containing 'nude, partially-nude, or otherwise sexualized images, videos, or other depictions of individuals,' not limited to child pornography.
